Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you must”
Reviews.Author: Teaselshiva
Reviews.Content: I was fatally attracted by the price especially as this was my first visit to Docklands and the locaton looked and was good. The journey on the 'toy' train - the LDR - turned out OK [no more than that!], but the hotel was a great disappointment. Reception in and out was good - quick and friendly. The room and ensuite were both very cramped though clean. You certainly couldnt swing a cat! The bed wasnt particularly comfortable and i was cold. There were no extra blankets and the heating did not work - they had obviously switched it off. I was very annoyed to discover there was no Free WiFi unless you went downstairs and perched uncomfortably in the foyer. a password was needed but not offered - and they appeared rather reluctant to provide it. You could of course pay for landline access in your room. I was most annoyed though to find the only food was either Chinese or their so called pub, both of which looked pretty grisly. None of their restaurants were open! Amazing. Luckily i found a pub beside the Excel building were i had an adequate meal. This place is to be avoided unless you like penny pincjing

Reviews.Title: “nothing other than location”
Reviews.Author: melga84
Reviews.Content: This hotel could do very well if they put a little effort into refurbishing the rooms and re-doing the menus. It's in a perfect location right opposite the station and 5 minutes from the excel centre but I have nothing else good to say about it. Upon checking into the hotel I was greeted and pointed in the direction of the lift as quick as I could blink my room was small and basic although I booked a superior room! and the bathroom was a portaloo! as for the food don't bother, breakfast was tasteless and dinner on the first night was like rubber. The decor throughout the hotel was completely different some doors brown, some pink, some purple and some purple and pink!! the wall paper in the rooms was peeling off as were pieces of wood from the furniture, no irons in the room there was an ironing room which was dirty and by dirty I mean the iron, ironing board and the room. Stayed here as it is close to the excel centre will not make the same mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “run-down stuffy hotel, zero value for money”
Reviews.Author: Emma B
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, the location of the Custom House Hotel seemed very convenient, as it as right opposite the DLR station. This, unfortunately, was about the only positive thing that could be said about our entire stay there. When we first arrived at reception, we had to pay a £50 maintenance fee, refundable on check out. Any hotel that insults its guests by charging this amount for such poor facilities is an immediate bad move. Walking through the corridors to our room, which was in the middle of nowhere, surrounded by rooms with no door numbers and cleaning cupboards, it seemed we had walked into the 1970s with the bright turquoise and fuchsia peeling walls and dirty carpet. We couldn't even find our room, surrounded by all these nameless doors, and when we eventually found it, it was a twin room instead of a double! So off back down to reception we went, and the receptionist was very rude and unsympathetic about the mix-up. When we eventually arrived in our tiny room, with an overnight ferry-style shower/toilet combo, and a sink in the corner of the room, we were less than impressed. There was a door in the wall that would lead through to the room next-door- UNLOCKED- which caused problems later in the evening, as the guests in that room were being shamelessly noisy and the thin walls and door let all of this noise through. It took 2 complaints to reception before someone came up to tell them to be quiet, although I have to say they fell dead silent after this! Our experience in the hotel's pub restaurant was less than satisfactory. It's 'award-winning' facilities, as it turned out, had won an award for hygiene .......... 4 stars?! (a basic standard you would expect in any restaurant!), not food or hospitality! We could see into the kitchen, and whilst we waited quite a while for our food, they were stood around chatting! The fish and chips were very greasy and served with tartare sauce in plastic pots- classy! The mattress in the bed was creaky and uncomfortable and the noise coming from outside the shut window was as if it were wide open! The shutters-down shops and building site across the road provided a not-exactly-scenic view. Then there was the continental breakfast! The worst we've ever had. The orange and apple juices tasted revolting, and I should've known that helping myself to a bowl of lumpy, congealed-looking yogurt was a bad idea- it tasted as if it had been kept out since the previous morning and I couldn't manage even half a spoon! As the only satisfactory option in the bare, dirty restaurant were croissants, and I can't eat pastry, we travelled into central London starving, and had the sense to buy our own breakfast for the next morning! Overall, a terrible experience- do not waste your money (even if it's only £50 a night!!) on this shambles of an excuse for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent trip to London. I chose this hotel because of the price. The hotel is right next to the DLR station so extremely easy to get into the city Centre. The room was a little small but as we only stayed one night it didn't matter too much. The only real problem was a few people making slot of noise 2 doors down but staff were quick to deal with the issue. All in all a good little hotel, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good staff members”
Reviews.Author: amy_dearsley
Reviews.Content: I stood last summer at this hotel and it was n ok experience. Altough the hotel was a bit far from the city center ( we had to change 3 lines to get there) and the rooms were quite tiny, the room was very clean and the towels were changed promptly. Also staff members were friendly and helpful. I remember I wanted to buy an adapter from the lobby but the nice man told us that if we need one we should ask for one at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean - stay clear of the pub though!”
Reviews.Author: AJT82
Reviews.Content: This was ideal for an overnight stay. Especially if you're attending anything at Excel exhibition centre - it's a 2 minute walk if that! I had a very basic twin room that was a little dated but was clean - and that's the main thing! It was an adjoining room though and the dhap who stayed next door to me had the most annoying cough most of the night!! I got a deal on a last minute website and have to say, I wouldn't pay the full amount they usually ask for. I do not recommend the pub next door at all. The food seemed to be microwved out the back and then given to the chef at the front of the pub to flash on a grill quickly to make it look good. A group of us ate together and most items were luke warm. Dessert - the waitor brought out lemon meringue pie when we'd ordered strawberry cheesecake and he didn't know the difference!!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubyeskimo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice now and would probably stay here again. It isn't the most fantastic hotel but for those of you wanting somewhere to rest your head after a hard day (and night) in London then this does the job. Nice basic rooms, which are very clean and the all-you-can eat breakfast make it worthwhile! It may be a bit out of the way for central London but the transport links are great. Would be a good base for the O2 or the Olympic Village.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Simplymo50
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this hotel whilst on a short break to London and I was quite happy with the hotel. Good location for travelling into the city for sightseeing. Rooms were a good size and nice and fresh with lovely clean bedding and comfy bed. Shower room was more than adequate size again spotless. I found the staff to be helpful and accommodating. We tried both types of breakfast but you have to pay £3.00 extra for cooked option and both types were very filling.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: jacko118Manchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on January 24th for one night when we went to the O2 Arena for the NTA awards. It was very clean, comfortable and warm. The staff was very helpful and it was only one stop on the train very convenient for the O2 Arena. We ate at the Chinese Resturant in the evening and it was fabulous. We would use this hotel again in the future with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy for Excel, and DLR to get into London and car parking”
Reviews.Author: athena130
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for London if you have a car and Excell

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawnieKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Custom House hotel on friday 10th Feb, for our trip to the 02 to see Snow patrol. The hotel cost just £39 for the night. The room was clean and the bed comfy, the only downside really was it was a very small bathroom. The bar does not open till 5pm so we had to take a short walk to the Fox bar for a drink. We took a cab to the 02 booked across the road from the hotel was just £15 each way, well worth the money as the tube looked very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Gingerfish46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as I was working at the Excel. We booked on line and paid £120. The rooms are clean, warm and comfortable. It is just a short 3 minute walk to the venue. We ate in the cafe on the first evening. The food was delicious and very reasonably priced. The bathroom is on the small side but very clean. I found it very good value for money. The only down side is the noise from the planes as it is close to London City airport. Will definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Alexx84
Reviews.Content: Rooms are rather small but can be worse, for two people with not many luggage is adequate. Bathroom is plastic composite, small, but clean, not that bad as described in other reviews. TV was OK, quite adequate size for the room with nice selection of channels for free. Continental breakfast (tea, cofee, hot chocolate, 3 juices, croisants, little baguettes and toast bread, selection of jams, cheese, eggs, butter... that is pretty much it but still quite good and very tasty (especially those croisants were exquisite)) was included in price (I am not sure if it is always). Upgradable to english breakfast for 3 quid. About 2 minutes from the DLR train door, and handy display with train departures (live) on the lobby, so you do not need to wait at the platform. In less then half an hour from your room or breakfast you can be at the London City Airport, or attend a meetnig in Bank area or Canary Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Daveengl
Reviews.Content: If your looking for somewhere cheap in London which is clean and has good transport options , this is perfect . I'd stay there again . . Watch out for the breakfast police though, they will throw you out if you even think about taking some cooked breakfast without paying the upgrade fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: diannenewman
Reviews.Content: Perfect for better. Much better quality than what you get in central London. Great service. Would definitely use again

Reviews.Title: “Ok for New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: johnofnorfolk
Reviews.Content: Room was fine and bed ok. Got the room for a good price and was used so we could see the new year in London. Staff was friendly and good full english breakfast to set you up for the day. DLR is across the road so getting in to London is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - no real complaints”
Reviews.Author: politicsandrew
Reviews.Content: This is a modern and fairly comfortable hotel in the heart of London Docklands, right next to the Docklands Light Railway and across the road from Excell. For an overnight stay on my own during a business trip I couldn't complain. Staff were friendly, the room was clean, food in the adjoining pub is well priced and tastes good and there was a reasonable choice for breakfast the next morning. Minor grumbles would be that the rooms are a little small if there's more than one of you (I had to move the bed to get to the wardrobe), the WIFI is a tad expensive and dodgy and my room was a bit cold during the night. I have paid far more for far worse hotels, will be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel during Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Robert W
Reviews.Content: We booked a (sub-)standard room for 50 Pst p/night, No value for money! Very small room for 2 persons. The mattresses were the worst i ever slept on ( suggestion to owner: Go the Ikea , buy the cheapest mattress, cannot be worse than yours ) . Noise of a generator and a loud singing Indian woman kept us awake. At 01.30 hrs we went downstairs and asked for a proper room. We got a 'superior' room at no extra charge . The mattress was somewhat better and we managed to move around in this room. The website suggests an en-suite bathroom but it appeared to be a small shower cabin, comparable with those used in a Motorhome which do not fit people with a B.M.I. higher than 25. Don't drop your soap because you can't bend over to pick it up unless you open the rolling screen. This room does not deserve the qualification "superior" . Television in the 'sub-standard' room did not work properly,but in the "standard" room it did. Any self-respecting hotel does not charge their guests for accessing the Internet but not Custom House Hotel. Sound a bit cheap,huh? Rooms were clean. If you ask for an extra blanket ( not present in the room) , the staff ask you to come downstairs to pick it up yourself. The rooms are so small that they don't fit central heating radiators. Instead they use a small electrical heating device which you can switch on if so desired.The food in the Cafe was okay as was the service. The Chinees Restaurant was closed during all 4 days of our stay.During this stay, no drinks/snacks available after 22.00 hrs. Although we were assured by the staff that the pub would be open till 23.00 hrs during christmas/boxing day, it was closed. Staff was friendly but the info they gave was not always reliable. They advised us to use a taxi as buses were not running . When we asked what that red double-decker was that was just passing the hotel, they looked very amazed. London Transport workers seem to use the Chistmas days to go on strike . We chose the Custom House hotel because of the nearby DLR-station. DLR did not run and of course you can't blame the hotel for this inconvenience. The taxi drivers use the DLR strike to rip you off by their increased tariffs. Again, think twice before deciding going to London during Xmas in combination with staying at Custom House.Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for O2”
Reviews.Author: Beccababydoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was the cheapest one we could find near the O2, and we weren't disappointed. The room was clean and the bed very comfy, needed after a long night! The breakfast was great, a help your self buffet, we opted for the full English. The DLR station is literally just across the road and the service is regular. Downside was the bar and all the restaurants were closed when we got back, would've been good to get some food and many people commented on this. My husband took a walk outside to see if he could find somewhere that was open and was confronted by a gang of youths - do not walk around there on your own. I would definitely stay here again if we go to another concert at the O2.

Reviews.Title: “pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: Mamun867
Reviews.Content: I came London to attend the winter meeting of British thoracic society at queen Elizabeth conference center ,west minister and due to convenience of transport ,stayed at custom house hotel,as the DLR station is opposite the door of hotel .but after my staying overall satisfaction is excellent by decoration, cost and staff attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, handy location for dlr”
Reviews.Author: Newbeetles
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights, convenient for public transport and just across the road from the Excel. Room basic but very clean, good TV stations available. Very good breakfasts, self-service but good and plentiful. Very attentive staff. Excellent double glazing, didn't hear traffic or any noise from City Airport, although could see the planes. Was somewhat perturbed by uniformed security checking the bedroom corridors, but very quiet hotel. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at hotel - Dec 2011”
Reviews.Author: Hove-Global-Travel
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced hotel, very close to Custom House DLR station, very convenient for travel into central London.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Dodododojo
Reviews.Content: We got the rooms very cheap, and so for the price it was perfect. The room was clean and comfortable. It's a very good location right opposite the dlr and excel. Really handy for getting into the city. We stayed on the top floor so well away from noise, etc. My only other thought is that breakfast is on the first floor so if you get a room on the first floor you may have lots of people walking past your door every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pixyflash
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel fairly basic but at around £60 a night for a London hotel it is good value. The room was clean, bathroom tiny but again clean. Did not have breakfast so cannot comment on the food. The staff were really nice and helpful. We arrived very early but were checked in with no fuss. Had a problem with a leaky shower, but sorted very quickly. We travelled by train but there was a large car park, not sure of the rates. The location is great for travel, right next to a tube station, but its quite a long way to the centre. Stayed for a couple of days and would recommend for a budget stay, when you are visiting London and not likely to spend much time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for, not fantastic but all the basics covered”
Reviews.Author: Jon K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly basic and middle of the road but that is what you would expect form a conference hotel pretty much to accomodate people from the nearby Excel centre. Right next to a DLR station communication links are good. The room is basic but comfortable enough with all the basic ammenities such as TV, towels, king size bed, etc. The bathrooom is similiar to a bathroom onboard a ships cabin. It is basically a bolt on, all in one, built in en-suite compartment, however i was expecting alot worse from the reviews I had seen on here, its small, but does the job, basically a small plastic wet room. The hotel has a couple of restaurants and bars but these are quite expensive. Location for the excel is great and the parking of £10 per day is reasonable. Would only stay here if I needed to be near the Excel or City Airport. One weird thing was the fact that there are speakers in the corridors playing music, which is all well and good, however you can hear them when youre in your room trying to sleep, I Had to ask reception to turn them off, which they did to be fair but was suprised they were everywhere in the hotel and so loud.

Reviews.Title: “Like trying to shower in the 'heads' of a very small yacht”
Reviews.Author: Coddfish
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the worst London hotel I have stayed in. Good points: very close to the DLR. Beds just about OK although the bedding was cheap and I'll fitting. Bad points: small bedroom, tiny wardrobe area, very poor quality breakfast with stale croissants and reconstituted juice, small thin towels. Awful, awful: the bathroom was a prefabricated plastic enclosure fitted into the room, resembling the 'heads' on a none too luxurious yacht. The shower had a plastic screen that ran around a circular track so that you enclosed yourself in a narrow diameter tube to shower yourself. Claustrophobic and impractical for anyone tall or wide. My 6ft tall normal build husband could not bend his legs sufficiently to soap his feet. There was also a lip to step over to get into the room, and another one on the bathroom - both easy to trip over. Our room had a connecting door to the neighbouring room through which it was possible to hear every word our neighbours said. Finally I felt this hotel (which charged more than, say, the Holiday Inn Express chain) offered very poor value for money. I think this is the only time I have ever felt the need to rate a hotel this way.

Reviews.Title: “Custom House - what a shower!”
Reviews.Author: johnrnick
Reviews.Content: The location was good and the staff pleasant. However if you want a shower don't try at 7.30 am. There was no water to shower in, or even in the taps. Fortunately there was enough left in my kettle for a shave. So smelling of last night's O2 I went for breakfast. The best thing about breakfast was the most welcoming Indian Maitre D. The cereals were pure sugar-toasted Kidz Stuff. Fine if you are into Coco Pops. The bacon reminded me of biltong. It had been a kind of meat before it was fried and dried. Even the mushrooms were leathery, but the strangled eggs were swallowable. The coffee was fine, and perhaps that's all that matters early on a London morning. Its aroma might have hidden the unwashed odour I trailed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: norman869
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews of this hotel, we discovered many issues unfounded. The close proximity to ther 02 was excellent as was the DLR. Yes the bathroom was on the small side but adequate none the less. The staff were all hepful and polite and the room service was excellent, having requested breakfast in our room. The room itself was clean and functional.We will be making a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: sophio91
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as we were seeing Lee Evans at the O2 so this hotel was convenient. Hotel rooms were very odd, as shower and toilet are like porter cabins! TV kept cutting out. When we arrived we were asked to pay a holding fund of £20 which we were surprised at as it wasn't advertised on the website we booked it on and usually they say if a holding fund is required. The receptionist said we would have it refunded in 3 days and was really quite rude about it as we wasn't aware. Anyway, a week passed and the money still did not appear in the account, have chased several times and nothing has happened, have even given the card details again! Makes me wonder if they are doing this to other customers as well and maybe they just haven't noticed it hasn't gone back in! Apart from this, the hotel is in a convenient location for the O2 and was a good price for the location. Takes about 30 mins to get into central London. Breakfast was good. Customer service not that great, stood at reception waiting whilst the staff just carried on talking to each other without even acknowledging us!

Reviews.Title: “Handy for DLR”
Reviews.Author: b16dnk
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stopped here and didn't disappoint. Staff friendly at reception, room clean but small but we knew that after all we just needed somewhere to sleep. TV, Tea, coffee etc hairdryer in room. Breakfast was included and was ample for our needs choice of cereals fruit and English but only scrambled eggs on offer. Can't speak for restaurant/bar as we were attending O2 for ATP world finals so ate over there and we were too late back to go into the bar. We would stay here again if attending O2, probably a bit far from central London for the sights but could be useful for Olympics 2012 as Stratford is on the DLR which is right across the road from the hotel. We went up to the Olympic stadium but couldn't get very close as construction is ongoing but from shoppahollics there is the Westfield Centre. Excel Centre is also right across, just over the DLR footbridge and you're there.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: JarmilaR
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my daughter during our trip to London and we really like the hotel. Room and bathroom were very clean (although the bathroom and toilet are very small), there was the fresh air there, the conditions were very good for two of us. The staff was friendly and helped us to solve what was needed.

Reviews.Title: “scary place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: What a dump!! I have never been in a hotel like it in my life. The room was so small that the toilet and shower were basically in what can only be described as plastic cupboards. The decor is 70s but in a very uncool way. Woodchip paper and tuquoise woodwork. I would suggest that you would be better off getting locked up for being drunk and disorderly for the night than enter this dump. The staff are friendly and helpful. But you can't polish up this dump with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “All the style of an asylum centre”
Reviews.Author: Mike2760
Reviews.Content: Locaton was excellent for Excel, but this was the only positive aspect. Rooms were small and ill-furnished; full-english breakfast unimpressive. Staff rude and management unresponsive. I was told (by telephone) to turn off my tv shortly after midnight because other guests could hear it - the volume was low, but the walls are paper-thin. In the middle of that call, a member of the night staff opened the door, walked in, saw me and left again - without saying a word and without closing the door. No response from management when I complained.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Janettravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, in front of the Custom house DLR stop and the West Entrance of the Excel. Rooms are small (especially the bathroom) but clean. I was booked in a superior double room but I would say it was a single room (for one person was fine). Breakfast was not exceptional but fine for the standard of the hotel. Staff was kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Ecel”
Reviews.Author: SunSurferDevon
Reviews.Content: Booked this for an event at Excel and was very pleased with location, the courteous staff and the overall experience. We drove to the hotel and parking was £10 for 24 hours (£20 at excel). Transport links too and from the hotel using the DLR 25 m away could not be better and you could not be closer to the exhibition centre entrance. The rooms were compact, clean and tidy with bathroom modules that worked really well, they have showers not baths. the rooms were quiet, I could control the temperature and from my fidth floor rooom i could see the new Olympic stadium at Stratford! These rooms were ideal for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but cheerful”
Reviews.Author: AliJohn65
Reviews.Content: Booked as it was close to the excel centre for mcm expo on the saturday. Stayed 3 night and although rooms small with plastic pod toilet and shower they were functional . Only problem was that door lock wouldnt open on first day and the fix by staff was to hit it hard !! Then due to this it wouldnt lock the next morning so couldnt go out until we knew it was fixed. Breakfast was ok , we had full english once but it wasnt that impressive for us to go again . However as we paid 70 a night for the location it was great , although a good 10/20 minutes to main london , would go again .

Reviews.Title: “Great for somewhere to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Jade-n-Lewis
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend picked this hotel as it was very cheap, after we had paid alot of money to see Lady gaga and for the train tickets to london we wanted something cheap! I had forgot to bring with me the booking reference but the receptionist found our booking quickly and checked us in and was very helpful. We got to our room and it was exactly what we wanted somewhere to sleep after going to the gig. It was lovely and warm in the room to say we satyed there in the middle of december during the bad winter last year. the only negative is the size of the 'bathroom' but we just used it to freshen up and use the toilet so was fine for us, what more do people expect for £50! The location of the hotel is great you step off the tube and practically straight into the hotel. We couldnt of asked for more for a 1 night stay and we both have said we would definately stay here for our next london adventure :) The beds were really comfy and the quilts were thick. When you turn on the tv you get a notification on saying 'welcome -your name- to custom house hotel' we thought that was a nice touch :)

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: miamix3
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay the Custom House hotel and I absolutely go back! After reading the reviews, I was dreading the stay but it was great with no problems at all. Staff are nice, rooms are a decent size with complimentary tea and coffee and the pub next door is a real winner! If anyone has problems with sleeping- take ear plugs! The trains really weren't a problem and I'm a pretty light sleeper. Great place and a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel with cabin bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Gordi1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during the recent WorldSkills London Competition and I will never come back! The rooms are poor, the bed really bad, pillows awful, the noise of the DLR can be heard from the room, the bathroom (if you can call them like that) reminded me of ferry cabins... breakfast is basic and juice cannot be drunk! Please avoid it if you can! The staff in the breakfast room were very nice though... The lifts kept on breaking which meant having to climb to the 5th floor on foot.... The only good thing about this hotel was its location for ExCeL London...

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: W B
Reviews.Content: the website is more promising than real. Bar is closing already at 10 p.m. Breakfast is very poorthis is not an hotel for business men... During breakfast the tabel went broken it was a mass.....

Reviews.Title: “If going to Excel Centre it was ok”
Reviews.Author: jcjcjc
Reviews.Content: £130 per night for very basic hotel with very squeaky bed. (It was clean at least) Could not be any handier for Excel Centre and also ok for London City Airport which is only a few minutes drive but couldn't recommend it for any other reason. At about 10pm I tried ringing downstairs to arrange an alarm call for the next morning. I rang every option but no reply. In the end I had to get dressed again and go down myself. We didn't eat at the hotel but had one drink in the rather miserable bar. Wont rush back. Also, you may want to check out what is on at the Excel Centre before you book. Whatever was on the night we stayed involved lots of police all over the road and station opposite.

Reviews.Title: “OK for One Night”
Reviews.Author: EODUK
Reviews.Content: If you have to be at the Excel Centre for 2 days this hotel is fine for an overnight stay, paid £160.0 for one night, but all I was after was easy access to the Excel Centre for an exhibition I was attending. DLR on the doorstep, not a good place to get a black cab into London. Local minicabs avoid as they are foreign drivers who don't know London at all.

Reviews.Title: “Custom House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hidanovic21
Reviews.Content: The staff are very confusing and unclear about their procedures. The hotel tends to double charge you as it was my case. Pay attention when making reservations in this hotel. Rooms are smaller than described and with very tight showers. Almost impossible to move in them. The price doesn't really reflect the quality.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK but we won't go back”
Reviews.Author: kittyWestMidlands_UK Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We were at Custom House last weekend and although the Superior rooms were clean and tidy, they were very small but not as small as the pod like bathroom we did not like the bathroom and if you like to move in the shower don't book here!!! The hotel was opposite DLR and Excel arena so good for getting in and out of London. Breakfast was good upgrade to English Breakfast was £3.00. Shame the bedroom and bathroom so small :-(

Reviews.Title: “It was ok for one night but wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: farmpirate Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was fine and everything was clean and tidy. The room was standard, the bathroom was similar to one in a caravan. Breakfast was average and there seemed to be very few tables vs the amount of rooms in the hotel. The hotel was in a convienent location and easy to find from the dlr station across the road. The hotel was fine for a night but wasn't really my taste so i would be unlikly to stay for a longer period of time or return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and would come again.”
Reviews.Author: moyranowak2006 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Easy to access via DLR and this frequent service meant it was easy to get around lots of areas of London which is what we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for events at the O2”
Reviews.Author: DaveB49
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 1 night to attend a concert at the O2. After reading previous reviews i thought it was going to be a dreadful say but i was suprised. Check in was quick and easy. I opted for the Superior Twin Room as it was only £10 more when i booked it. I must admit, the room was very basic but had everything you needed. And the bathroom was small but it was fine for us. We ate in the cafe before we set off out and the food was really nice and reasonably cheap. The chinese restuarant looked nice but we didnt eat there. The DLR is literally a stones throw away and cost us about £7.50 each for an off-peak return (zones 1-4) and the journey was really quick to the O2 (two stops on the DLR to Canning Town, then 1 stop to North Greenwich). We got the last tube back to the hotel around 12.15am. When we got back, there was still a few other guests in the bar area so we asked the staff on reception if there was anywhere to get a last drink before we went to bed and they opened the bar for us which i thought was really nice of them. I think the only downside to the stay was that our room overlooked the street and our window wouldn't shut properly so we heard everything through the night and as its near to an airport, we heard planes coming into land, what seemed like every 20 mins. Was nice to watch when your awake but when your shattered after a gig, it got quite annoying. Also we didnt have breakfast here as there is a nice greasy spoon cafe around the corner (think it was called Freemasons) with a range of all day breakfasts for £5-7 which was really nice and set us up for our journey home. Car parking was £10 for the night. I would stay here again if attending the O2 and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel, with flaws”
Reviews.Author: RichieJB
Reviews.Content: Its a bit like a travelodge with character. The decor is colourful (some might say garish) and a bit in need of touching up. The rooms are small, with a quite nasty shower room like a pod. One of them I staid in stank, and one morning there was no hot water. The air con controls were the wrong way round (e.g. turn up the heat to make it colder). The wifi cost 15 pounds and was in no way high speed- I emailed the supplier and they told me the hotel had limited it to 2Mbps, which was slower than my 3G dongle. The food was very nice though- both for the chinese and the better value pub food, which was served quickly. There wasn't much space for breakfast but it was good value compared to some other hotels I've been in recently. They did snatch your plates away as soon as you put the food in your mouth. I probably wouldn't stay here again unless I had to, but the good news is I slept very well,and I wasn't bothered by noise from the very close DLR station or the airport, at all. One more thing- when I arrived they denied I had a booking until they found they had booked me in for the previous night, by mistake. A friend had a similar problem when they booked him in for 3 nights, not the required 4.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Business or London sight-seeing.”
Reviews.Author: Silbury
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel with friends as part of an organised coach tour. We were not expecting a great deal in view of the price we had paid but were pleasantly surprised. Check-in was fast with the door cards already named and waiting for us. Our room, a twin, was not large but had everything we could want for one night. A separate shower and toilet were built in ‘pods’ but both spotlessly clean. The wash basin and unit were in the corner of the bedroom. It did not bother us but might not suit two people who wanted privacy. Soap and toiletries were provided. A small desk unit had a hair-dryer and kettle with tea/coffee. The open style wardrobe was right next to one of the beds so we had to climb on the bed to hang clothes up. We are pensioners but that was not a problem for us. Our friends had a double bed which was a slightly larger room with a separate bathroom and room to squeeze past the bed to get to the wardrobe. We ate at the Chinese Restaurant on the ground floor which was reasonably priced for London. It was a hot evening but we were able to open our window which looked over a quiet courtyard. The bed felt very firm but, as we had had a long journey, we soon fell asleep and did not wake until next morning. Our tour included Continental Breakfast. This was more than sufficient with fruit juice, cereal, fruit, cheese, boiled eggs, toast, rolls and croissants. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who just wants an overnight stay while visiting London. I have stayed in far more expensive hotels whose bathrooms were not as clean and where the noise/heat of the room has kept me awake.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for 02, very up to date rooms - shame the bar shut at 11pm”
Reviews.Author: sooze29
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very good, clean and modern and very happy with the room. Check in service friendly and location excellent for the O2, just hope on the DLR to Canning Town, go down one flight of Stairs to Jubilee line and one stop for Greenwich 02. Only disappointment was we had asked if the bar was staying open late, as we were seeing Iron Maiden and there were a lot of fans and they said yes when there is a big gig, however getting back at 11pm and the bar shut. We all managed to get one drink but it wasn't the same when you wanted to sit around and chat about concert. We didn't have breakfast in hotel as got up a little late but around the corner was a greasy spoon, which did a really good English breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, as ever.”
Reviews.Author: Doggos Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times since 2005, for both business and pleasure. My daughter and her boyfriend have also stayed here a few times. Sure, it's a budget hotel, with seriously compact rooms, but the facilities are well designed, and have always been well serviced, the staff have always been good, the underground station is just across the road, the pub downstairs is good, and the Chinese restaurant is to die for (look forward to that everytime I go!). In addition, unlike most hotels I've stayed in, the sound-proofing is great--I've never once been bothered by the noise of other guests, even when the place is packed. If you're a very large person or very heavily pregnant, this might not be an ideal choice. If you're used to luxury hotels and posh areas, it won't be your thing. If you want convenience and great value for money, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: beaconoutbound
Reviews.Content: The first room we were allocated had yellow stains on the toilet seat. The replacement room we were given had a general stench of faeces and the toilet had no toilet seat! During the night we noticed the window wouldn't close and reported this the next morning. They promised to fix it by the time we got back to the hotel room, but this did not happen.

Reviews.Title: “Massively disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Cinderelle-oh
Reviews.Content: We booked at the VERY last minute for a quick get away - as we needed to be in the area. We paid £80 for a night and found the hotel outdated, overpriced and staff surly. From the moment we checked in at reception, the receptionist barely grunted hello at us, before giving us our room key - not telling us where to go (we had to ask!). We found our room and our hearts sank. It was like a portacabin. The sink is in the actual bedroom and the bathroom and shower room are similar to that on a 2* windowless cruise ship. It is claustraphobic, there is no view on the inside, the walls are thing and the room is dated. You need to know the person you share a room with very very well. I expect the hotel have some renovatd rooms and others that havent been, and depending on a) when you booked b) how much the receptionist likes you (in our case, not a lot!) and c) the rate you paid - this will determine the room you are given. (Im an ex hotel worker!) Parking was £10 a day too. The month before we had stayed at the IBIS and I rate this way over Custom House. We will absolutely NOT be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good, near ExCel”
Reviews.Author: defone
Reviews.Content: Actually expected much worse but this turned out good experience. Room was small but ok for one. Also it was warm which I count as a big plus in London hotels (thanks to some london hotels, especially at the Hyde, I always bring woolen socks when travelling there) Recommended for ExCel visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, with good transport links to central London”
Reviews.Author: Krzysztof34
Reviews.Content: We were two nights in this hotel and were pleased. Good connection to central London by DLR lines (30-40 minutes) and at nights by night bus no. N551. I recommend this hotel for sightseeing and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “7th june -9th june”
Reviews.Author: topTravellerFfi
Reviews.Content: great location.. across the road from the train stations and 15 mins away from central london, 10 mins away from the o2 arena.. easy to use the train, better to get £7.30 tickets as you can go anywhere all day excellent room beds really confy bathrooms very small.. looks abit like a caravan bathroom didnt eat at the resturant as we were out every night staff where really nice and helpful only downfall is parking is £10 a night

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Functional”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Guildford_Pair
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my sister when going to O2. Easy journey there and back to O2. Booked a "superior twin room" - hotel easy to find, across the road from DLR station. Staff who booked us in were "doing their job" - no personal attention. Room tiny- bathrom "pod" was awful, and smelled disgusting (like blocked drains). That being said, if you need a rooom for a night, no frills, it'sotherwise fairly clean, bar open till 11.30pm, basic bed for the night. Very close to Excel.

Reviews.Title: “discounted price is just right”
Reviews.Author: williamstoph
Reviews.Content: we needed an affordable hotel for overnight stay when we visited Chelsea Flower Show and so we booked this hotel from a "late rooms" site at a discounted rate - the rate charged was appropriate - i wouldnt say the normal price reflects the grade of the accomodation. Breakfast was extra at 10gbp each and although you can take as much as you like from the english and continental buffet the cost is typical london rate. The bar meals and drinks are over priced so instead of spending time in the public areas we resorted to an early night in our room The location close to the DLR (Custom House stop- close to EXCEL centre ) makes this an easy hotel to find and is ideal for EXCEL and O2

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Excel... that's all”
Reviews.Author: DontMakeMeStayThere
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Excel and you want convenience then this is your hotel; it has no other merits. The beds and pillows are hard, the duvets thin and flat, the rooms small and characterless with injection-moulded shower and toilet podules. The area around Custom House is desolate and you would never venture outside unless it was to get on the train and go straight to Town. Mercifully the trains are frequent and comfortable so doing so is not difficult. If you like a good night's sleep then take your own pillow and some earplugs - the airport is half a mile away and flights start at 06:30.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location if you want to be just outside the hussle & bustle”
Reviews.Author: mumof2Leicestershire Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location situated right next to the light railway. Very easy to get into the centre of London ( just a few tube stops and you're there). Continental breakfast was the best we've ever had. We asked for a quiet room before we travelled & they put us on the back away from any lifts which was perfect! Couldn't have asked for a better service :0) The only downside was the shower was a bit small to move around in and they only provide enough tea-bags & milk in the room for a cup of tea each. We would definetly use this hotel again if we ever escape the kids again for the weekend!

Reviews.Title: “The drawbacks of a no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorki22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights and had booked a twin bedded room with my sister. I have never stayed in a room that was so small before. To get to the wardrobe you had to stand on the bed which at times was so funny but not good for people of our age. The small capsule shower was so tiny and there was no room to dry off, in order to do this you had to step back into the room. No room to put our suitcases and they were moved constantly in order for us to move in the small space we were given. Our room overlooked a main road which was constantly busy with traffic and general noise from members of the public. Unfortunately I dont think we would use this hotel again and would opt for a travel lodge instead. At least the rooms are of good size if nothing else. and onto the traffic lights and there was a constant noise from the traffic which went on most of the night. The room would have been ideal for a single traveller not two people. The breakfast was more than adequate for us and staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: worldgirl
Reviews.Content: Despite the hotel renovations going on, this hotel was fabulous! I was in between homes so traveling with my two well-behaved dogs... we never felt displaced. The staff is super agreeable, the valet guys always cheerful, the front desk folks -- Xandra and Chelsea very accommodating and kind. Great value and a sense of style for the bucks... plus the hospitable staff allows you to overlook their renovations... I'd stay again -- and in fact may be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Superior about Superior Rooms”
Reviews.Author: scojoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is similar to an Ibis - a basic no frills hotel with those hortid tiny plasticy toilet/shower units in the corner of a somewhat cramped room. I stayed here as all the other named hotels near the Excel were full. Booked a 'Superior' room but there is nothing superior about it. Even queried it with reception as I thought there must have been a mistake. But alas, this was what they call a Superior room. Cleanliness fair but there was a rotten smell in the corridors. Didn't try the restaurant as it didn't look very appealing. Sultry staff. Location convenient for Excel, but there's nothing else in the surrounding area in this part of the East End and it's a bit of a journey on the DLR/Tube to get to central London. Some people on a budget might find this place ok if they get the rooms at a heavily discounted rate. I didn't and I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Excel”
Reviews.Author: karenwestbury
Reviews.Content: We where very pleased to see that the Excel was so close, we arrived at 12 miday andwe were at Excel by 1pm having booked in room and dropped of bags. Parking cheap and easy. We didn't move car once during stay and paid £10! . DON'T book a taxi for O2 though ! . Is only a couple of minutes on Train and a couple of quid. We paid £20 for a 5 min drivein cab ! Also Cafe was closed on sunday, we had a lie in thinking we'd have breakfast in cafe but found we had to go hungry : ( ...Would book again if visiting Excel but would compare with Premier Inn, also equally as close.....

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, pretty basic - and don't use the taxi service”
Reviews.Author: Sweetkoshka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right across from the Custom House light rail stop, so for anyone needing to get to London City Airport early in the morning it's a good choice (you could actually walk to the airport if you had time and not much baggage). But it's definitely not a place to write home about. The staff, while not rude, were certainly not friendly or welcoming. The rooms are pretty small, the shower tiny... and there was a slight smell of sewage from the bathroom (we had to close the door overnight so we couldn't smell it in the bedroom). Also, beware: City Airport is just a five-minute cab ride away, but the hotel uses a private hire company which is a complete rip-off. The hotel quoted GBP 7 for a trip to the airport in the morning, and since we had a fair bit of luggage we decided to take a cab. When we arrived at the airport, however, the driver tried to charge us a ridiculous 12 pounds for the short trip. Short version: we wouldn't stay there again. Among other things, I won't patronize hotels that charge large amounts for Internet use (15 pounds was the asking price here).

Reviews.Title: “If you're around 30 years old, read this.”
Reviews.Author: matthaumschild
Reviews.Content: The room is small, but if you're by yourself, it's more than adequate for most of your needs. Pluses and Minuses: Pluses: Location of the Lightrail (LRT). It's litterally, right where the hotel is, which is quite convieniet. It's also very close to City airport and near a half a dozen different landmarks. It's cheap. Meaning, they won't charge an arm and a leg for the room, they give you a bed, you're own bathroom, shower, ect. The bed itself isn't bad at all. Minuses: They don't supply free internet which is a drawback, although Wi-Fi connection is available for a price. The hotel charges per call, even if it's a local call at outragous prices, be prepared. Overall, I say stay here anyway. If anything, for the price of the room, just have everything prepared before you arrive, such as maps. Going on-line isn't terribly expensive, it's just kind of annoying, or just make sure your cell/mobile provider gives you decent intl' data roaming.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: KH_1989
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for two nights and couldn't really fault it. The room we stayed in was clean and the price I paid included a continental breakfast, which was ideal! The hotel offered a decent bar and cafe and a car park. The surrounding area is not great, but the tube station is literally across the road so it is ideal for getting into central London. I would recommend this hotel, as it was good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rochycoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was the best value hotel i could find. only paid £50 via last minute website for room, no breakfast. its just over the road from custom house tube station so travel into central london didnt take that long. the room was basic but clean. large shower cubicle, free toiletries. our room was at the front, overllooking the road and the tube station. the double glazing on the windows was poor so i could here traffic noises clearly, this wasnt ideal as i am a light sleeper and was awoken at about 5.30am by traffic from passing buses, lorries, etc. i suggest asking for a room at the back if this is a concern. the local area seems ok but i wouldnt recommend wondering round late at night. we arrived back at the hotel at around 11pm and felt safe enough probably due to the fact that the distance from tube station to hotel is about 20 foot. Parking onsite was available at £10 per night but we didnt use it as we travelled by train. all in all, depending on the price you pay, this hotel is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Port-a-loo bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Mesulina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to visit the O2, and it is a trek to get there by road from this hotel, especially if the Dartford Tunnel is closed! The rooms are small but clean, however, the carpet was so thin you feel the nails in the floor boards. And as other people have said the shower capsule in the plastic 3 foot wide "bathroom" is ridiculous! The hotel is also on the flight path from City airport, so very noisy, which makes the windows and walls rattle! The staff were really rude and unpleasant and the breakfast in the morning was poor with really poor quality food. It's also £10 per night to park, which is not on any of their advertisements. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave money in your room”
Reviews.Author: Woody1209
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. But don't leave money in your room as I had mine stolen. I notified reception who then informed housekeeping. The next day I asked to update me on the situation to be told that the chamber maid had not taken it. So thatveas that then.

Reviews.Title: “very clean, fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jody251084
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my mum on a visit to salon international last year, i found the reception staff to be very friendly and welcoming, very quick and efficient service. our room was very clean and had tea/coffee facilities etc. our bathroom consisted of a seperate bathroom (wet room) and toilet both were also very clean. we had our dinner in the chinese restaurant within the hotel, slightly pricey but this is london! I would highly reccomend the duck pancakes and cantonese beef! overall a great hotel in a convenient location at a very cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: RobIpswich
Reviews.Content: Situated just yards from Custom House Docklands Light Railway station and the Excel exhibition centre, it has a very good location. A good choice of in house eating facilities - a cafe, a chinese restauarnt and a pub serving food. Rooms more than adequate - the only slight drawback is the fairly high cost for internet use. Good local bus links also available.

Reviews.Title: “functional”
Reviews.Author: scottish_dr
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this hotel, and paid for a "superior room". The room was quiet and clean, however I'm afraid that's it. The bathroom was small, and felt like a portaloo, while the room itself was fairly small. Breakfast wasn't wonderful by any means, and was very busy with lots of young people. Location is ok, just beside a DLR station, however I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FIRE FIASCO”
Reviews.Author: saffery33
Reviews.Content: Nightmare stay and would never go again. People were taking drugs and the staff really didnt care. Then we had a fire and the evacuation would not be out of place in fawlty towers, including evacuating guests while still booking in other guests and telling us to evacuate towards the fire other than that if you like cheap small plastic rooms this hotel will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monstermunch11987
Reviews.Content: If your on a budget and want more than just bed and breakfast this is the place. Has a secure attended 24hr car park. Decent sized rooms, very clean. Close to DLR. has resturant + bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay on New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: BR84Kotor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for new years eve, its about half an hour from central London but is ideal as the DLR station is literally across the road from the hotel. I was a little worried about what the rooms would be like as all the other hotels in the same price bracket were awful but couldn't have been more pleased. The only problem I had was the walls are quite thin, which may have been due to the adjoining door but due to it being new year I had expected the extra noise. Would definitely stay again, the rooms are clean and the staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with very good customer service”
Reviews.Author: manjy Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was verty clean, and well cared for throughout our stay. Excellent clean bed linen. Staff on reception desk very helpful, with excellent information on public transport services. Delighted to have ample parking. Deiappointed that on 2 nights the bar closed early at 10.00 - would have thought a hotel bar should be open until midnight. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Leonardordel92
Reviews.Content: My gf and I stayed in this hotel becuase we went to see Shakira at the O2 Arena. We paid £110 for a double room. The room was alright, there was a TV, the bed was clean and the shower and the toilet were separated. That day we forgot to take our laptop to the hotel so we decided to use the Internet at the hotel. I WAS SHOCKED AT THE PRICE OF THE INTERNET!!!!! 15mins for £3!!!!!! THAT IS THE MOST EXPENSIVE INTERNET SERVICE I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY LIFE!!!!! for this reason i could not on the internet and communicate to my family becuase it was expensive and it was snowing outside. The "bar was closed so we went to a pub thta was next to reception and a the cost of fish and chips was £10. it was 9pm so we decided to go for chinese which wasnt that bad. The staff was not very friendly apart from the guy who attended us when we went for breakfast. I was very pleased for the continental breakfast becuase you can eat whatever you want for £6. The location is perfect but apart from that there is nothing around. There is not entertaining and if you want to watch a movie it costs £9 so in that case go to the cinema hahahaha.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you are attending an ExCel exhibition”
Reviews.Author: DimitrisGiannoulakis
Reviews.Content: If you are attending an ExCel exhibition and you want to be close to the ExCel center, Custom House Hotel is a very good choice. It is straight opposite ExCel center and it makes it very easy even to return to you hotel for noon or going to your hotel room just to go to the toilet. There are buses and also the underground to down town London and in general transportation is easy. One problem that I found was the “thin” walls. One night I was told off about having my TV loud and I really think it was not loud at all. It might have happened because I was allocated in an interconnecting room (of course the connecting door was locked) and I guess the door couldn’t stop the noise. However I was irritated by that. Another thing is that the bathroom looks like those in boats, with plastic walls and floors, which for me was not a problem but it surprises me because I have not seen this kind of bathrooms in any other hotel. The shower is relatively small. In general I would say that Custom House Hotel is a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good basic accommadation”
Reviews.Author: penny097
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, to go sightseeing in London and to visit the O2. The accommadation was modern ,clean, and comfortable, no frills but perfect for our needs. The reception staff were generally friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast (not included) was a bit basic but enough, there was also the option of a cooked breakfast.The hotel is opposite the underground station which made it easy to get into central london, which took about 1/2 hr but perfect for the O2, which took us 15-20 mins, and the majority of the crowds from the O2 seemed to be going in the opposite direction. I would definately use it again if going to the O2.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: JH72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect in everyway, Location, Clean....it even has its own chinese restaurant on the ground floor and a pub next door - all interlink so you don't even have to go outside. The staff are friendly and give you all the information you need - the lobby even has the train times on a board (for the docklands light railway) just like an airport! I don't see how this hotel can be faulted in anyway what so ever. I grew up in the surrounding area and although some of the streets around are still abit rough the hotel is a real diamond! There is an off licence around the corner in freemasons road, 2 mins walk away. Journey time = 15 mins to Canary Wharf and no more than half an hour into the city. The hotel has 2 lifts. The car park is £10 per day, all rooms have coded safes. An absolutely great stay! Thanks Custom House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for the 02”
Reviews.Author: Helee77
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for a few days while visiting London, picked it as it was near the 02 for which it was perfect but if you are wanting to see the sights of london this is probably a little bit too far out - around 30 mins of tube and DLR on a good trip. Hotel staff were very friendly and the room was very comfortable, although it had a bizarre little bathroom... Rooms were very warm and cleaned daily. Good choice of places to eat at the hotel if you didn't fancy venturing out in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Not one to visit unless you're going to the Excel centre”
Reviews.Author: elleay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend as we were going to an exhibition at the Excel centre. For this purpose, the hotel is perfectly located and incredibly convenient. However, my last minute booking was exorbitantly expensive for what was a very small room with strange plastic boxes for shower and toilet and poor sleep quality. Breakfast wasn't bad, and the bar is pleasant enough, but it's definitely not worth the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for O2”
Reviews.Author: IrishRomantic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. We had got a very good rate for a standard twin and whilst the room was small (you pay for what you get!) it was more than adequate for us as we didn't spend much time in it. It was very clean and comfortable and very handy for the O2. We saw the superior rooms and they were much larger. We only had beakfast on one day and that was good, great choice for Continental for the price, the coffee wasn't great though would have tea another time! Will certainly stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “I would rather sleep in a youth hostel, will never return in my life”
Reviews.Author: baik_uk
Reviews.Content: If you want a reasonable nights sleep dont book a night at this hotel, the service is awful, the walls are paper thin, the water in the shower is cold, the tv doesnt work, and the shower is a perfect size- if you are a dwarf. The area this hotel is located in is extremely rough and I would not recommend going out alone after dark. It makes a travelodge look like the Ritz! I paid £95 for room only for 1 night- it wasnt work £9! Please do not stay here- if you do and complain to the staff, nothing will get done and you will have an awful stay.

Reviews.Title: “cheap, ideal for excel or 02”
Reviews.Author: leekie1977
Reviews.Content: I was concerned before i arrived as some of the reviews were not that great, was just myself and my 14 year old daughter and was her birthday present to see paramore at the o2 so wanted a nice trip. On arrival at the hotel we were upgraded to a deluxe twin which was a nice surprise, the room was clean, albeit small!! As many have said before the dlr stop is right opposite making getting around easy, the jubilee line wasnt working which meant buses to/from the o2 but not a problem, got back to the hotel at 11.20pm and the bar had closed at 11pm but they still served us drinks (quite pricey!!), we just took them to our room. Had a lovely nights sleep, pillows were amazing I wanted to take them with me!! All in all was a good stay, if I was going to sight see or shop however would stay more centrally, as there is nothing at all in the immediate area apart from the Excel which has hardly anything open unless they have events on. One thing to add, they "hold" an extra £20 on your card payment in case you use the restaurant etc which was odd seing as i paid for my drinks at the bar in cash!!

Reviews.Title: “2* Rooms with 3*Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Bookmytrip_co_uk
Reviews.Content: I was dissappointed with the rooms as they are basic and if it wasn't for the flat screen TV would have likened it to a hostel and I was in a superior room, but the hotels has great facilites, good quality Chinese Restaurant, a modern Cafe and a Pub Kitchen with a good atmosphere. Breakfast is basic but a good standard and plentiful. This hotel is in a great location for ExCel, any closer and you'd be falling out of bed and through West Entrance Doors, but the immediate area leaves a lot to be desired, and not a good location for Londons central attractions, taking about 45mins on the Tube and DLR from Euston (although as I was just visiting ExCel it was fine). I would have recommended this hotel to a friend or booked it for a customer until I visted the reception restrooms just after checkout, and a member of the kitchen staff emerged from the sole cubical (after making some pretty horrific noises) and left without washing his hands. I know it must happen all the time but I really don't won't it thrown in my face when I've had my last 3 meals there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay and will visit again but it was a bit over-priced for the basic room.”
Reviews.Author: Mh9O
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location because the DLR station (Custom House Hotel for Excel) is located right outside which means it doesn`t require much walking. The service at the hotel was OK, when we checked in, the hotel staff are there to help but doesn't seem that friendly and approachable which made me hesitate to ask questions, they looked like they are only there to do their job and wouldn`t really go the extra mile. The standard room that we booked was very good. The cleanliness of the room was good, room was a reasonable size but I think paying £104 for it wasn't worth it because the room was very basic. We didn't really eat in any of the restaurants but we went into the cafe located by the reception to buy a bottle of water but the cafe had closed by the time we got there. The lady that was working there seemed very unhelpful and said that they were closed and when I asked is there a vending machine where I can buy water from she just looked at me with a blank look. But, then a gentlemen which I believe was the head chef was very helpful as he said to me "is it water that you want?" and served me two bottle of water which I thought was very nice of him. Overall, I think that Custom House Hotel is a nice hotel and I will be staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DisabledTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel whilst attending a function at the Excel Centre, I would suggest booking a hotel when you know that you are attending something there as the hotels round the area get booked real fast. I left it a bit late and booked this hotel, even though I booked it about 2 weeks before the event it was still at a reasonable price, I believe it was approximately £95 for the night (breakfast not included). I would say that this hotel is closer to the Excel Centre but feels further as you have to walk up all the steps and along platforms to get across the DLR to the centre. I only used Custom House for a place to crash so I don't know what the food and the drinks are like in the bar and restaurant. The staff at reception seem really helpful and will answer any queries, I also parked in the carpark which is at the rear for the night and it was about £10.

Reviews.Title: “Bare essentials but perfect for Excel”
Reviews.Author: QUEENOFEUROPE
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient for Custom House DLR and across the road from Excel. We stayed in a double room which is purely functional, great if all you wish to do is sleep but not large enough............the room was similar to a small berth in a cheap ferry; on the plus side, it was spotless. The attached bar and restaurant served great meals and the food prices were lower than anticipated however, bar prices were off the scale. There is also a Chinese restaurant within the hotel but the prices were ridiculous, a tube trip to Chinatown would be a better option. Price wise, it is overpriced, breakfast has to be ordered as extra.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, overpriced and rooms awful”
Reviews.Author: Perdylady75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on saturday night with a friend to attend a ball at the excel. We stayed in a twin room which cost £95! the bathroom smelt disgusting and the room had not been cleaned properly. Should be £40 a night

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: unforgiven9
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the first time in June 2010 to see Bon Jovi at the O2 and was so impressed, chose to return there in August 2010. Yes the rooms and bathrooms are small but what do you expect for the price in London. We found them to be perfectly adequate for our needs. We chose the superior room both times so not sure what the standard rooms are like. A continental breakfast is included in the price but you can upgrade for an extra fee to full English. we decided to see how the continental was before deciding whether to upgrade. as it turns out, the continental breakfast was full and filling and very good. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel bar and cafe are ideal for your drinks and snacks. The hotel is in the ideal location for the O2 arena and although it is a bit far from central London (we found about 35 mins on metro) we found it no problem and managed quite well to go to central LLondon in the morning, do a couple of attractions, return to the hotel to eat shower and change and still get to the west end shows at night. Next time I go to London, I will definitely choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible.”
Reviews.Author: geoffmorley
Reviews.Content: If your only business in London is at either the Excel centre or the 02 then the location of this hotel is OK - although getting back from the O2 after a show is not easy, and you may need a £20+ taxi to get back. If you want to see any more of London you'd be better off spending more money and staying more centrally. We spent hours looking at the delights of Tower Hamlets on the DLR going to and from Tower Hill Gateway. The rooms are small and spartan, and others have described the toilet pods and showers, which are OK, but it's definitely not luxury. The bar closes early, and once it is shut, you can't get even a bottle of water in the hotel. On a Sunday lunchtime all that is available is the hotel's Chinese restaurant - no other food, coffee or drinks. The surrounding area is decidedly on the rough side, and I wouldn't want to venture too far away from the hotel at night - not that there is anything to see or do if you do decide to take a stroll. All that can be said for this place is that it is cheap - but I would never stay here again, and would strongly encourage others to heed some of the other warnings on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Return”
Reviews.Author: john7512
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful. However the hotel itself must have a sewage problem because the entire hotel smells terrible (including the rooms). Absolutely nothing is included, wifi, etc. Oh, we even were charged 2 pounds per day for use of the room safe. There is really nothing nearbye. Nowhere to eat. The train is directly across the street. Which is very convenient when you'll be traveling everyday to the areas where you should have stayed in the first place. It seemed like we were staying in a convention free convention area. We were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “SURPRISINGLY GOOD!”
Reviews.Author: Ramscubora
Reviews.Content: 20min away from city center. in front of London Victoria DLR. perfect location for London City Airport (few min.) During night time extremely calm, which is perfect for light sleepers like myself. Apart the usual rude people making noise at night once back from town, the hotel is really silent at night. Room was quite good (i had a superior), extremely clean!! beds are comfortable and shower room, even if bit tiny, it was spotless and everything was working good. staff is very polite. ive asked for a late check-out and they agreed without charging me. will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: newfiesusan
Reviews.Content: Ths hotel was clean and comfortable and directly across from the Docklands Light Railroad which made it convenient for travel. The trip from tower bridge was longer than I had expected but you can't get anywhere in a hurry in London. It was a great value for the money and I couldn't find a hostel for two people for the same cost. The contental breakfast was adequate and included boiled eggs which at least put some protien in the meal. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: RachelP_10
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here as we went to see Rhianna at the O2 arena. It took us about an hour and a half to find the hotel, even with a Sat Nav! When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly face and swiftly got to our room. Although the hotel is quite far from the main attractions there is the DRL line that runs from just outside the hotel and you can transfer then to the underground line. The rooms are clean and modern but the beds aren't the comfiest. the shower and toilet are very weird rooms as they are a bit like plane toilets! Overall we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “The room was o.k. same cannot be said for staff and location”
Reviews.Author: ramonar07
Reviews.Content: We went to London for a weekend stay. We had a fabulous time in the city and at the West End. We had been wrongly advised that this hotel was quite central and whilst it may be a perfect location for the O2, it is not really suitable for those who wish to spend a lot of time in the city centre. It took us well over an hour to travel to the hotel from Leicester Square by public transport, additionally the DLR (Docklands Light Railway) was out of service so this obviously elongated our journey time. When we arrived at the hotel and were checking in we were informed that our credit card would be charged £20 in addition to the cost of the room incase there were 'any extras', I wonder what extras they were speaking of as there was nothing in the room that would have incurred a cost, no mini bar etc... Additionally when I asked for a receipt for this I was told that it was not a transaction but a hold on the card and therefore no receipt for that could be issued and a receipt for the room would be issued at check-out. I thought that this was reasonable enough and proceeded to the room. The room was basic but o.k. fine for a budget trip. When checking out the following day again I asked for a receipt and this time was told that it would have been emailed to me from the online booking. I have had no receipt emailed to me and to be honest I cannot understand the reluctance of the staff to provide me with a receipt when I request it, regardless of whether it was emailed to me or,in this case, not. In summary BAD LOCATION FOR CITY CENTRE TRIPS, UNPLEASANT STAFF but AN O.K. ROOM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money.....”
Reviews.Author: Deb F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were meeting friends who were also staying here. We had a standard room and our friends had superior rooms. I would definately book a superior room next time as the standard rooms were incredibly small.....one night was enough in a standard room, as I am quite claustrophobic and found space and ease of movement quite hard...there was no bathroom but a sink in one corner of the room and the shower and toilet were in seperate 'pods' at the other end. The hanging space is next to the bed and hard to access.....there was no room safe so valuables had to be carried with you..........however the superior rooms were much more spacious with a seperate bathroom room safe. Air con is extra. The hotel itself is very clean and the staff very friendly. Beds were very comfortable and bed linen lovely and fresh and white. The hotel has secure parking facilities and is outside the congestion zone......for £10 overnight and if you wish to stay a little longer after checking out you pay an extra £5 which was really helpful. You may check in early if room is ready and if not ready.... luggage may be left in a secure storage room. Breakfast was good...no queues......although when someones' toast caught fire in the toaster it was a little disconcerting to note that the smoke alarm directly above did not alarm!!! The hotel is opposite the DLR station and close to the O2....I would stay here again as it was excellent value for money....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for O2”
Reviews.Author: Taffman
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a Bed and Breakfast package. The hotel is right on the DLR, so getting to the O2 and around London was easy and convenient. Rooms were spotlessly clean and although of a modest size, were comfortable and really quiet at night. The shower etc is in a self contained pod at one end of the room, but it is functional and well appointed. Breakfast was included and was buffet style, with everything from a full English to continental with pastries, meats and cheese. It was a great start to the day and really great value. There is a bar at the hotel with reasonable prices and a comfortable lounge. All staff we met were friendly. Great hotel for the price and due to its transport links fine for the O2 and Central London.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but nothing else going for it”
Reviews.Author: jejon
Reviews.Content: we booked a deluxe room but found ourselves in a cupborad with no window only an uncovered sky light on questioning reception we were told unpleasantly next time you should request a room with a window (what next time no way ) eventually and begrudgeingly moved to a room with a window. budget accommodation maybe but rude unpleasanr staff make for an unpleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy comfort, cleanliness, and a good nights sleep don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: nickd911
Reviews.Content: After booking this last minute for a work event I was completely disappointed by the entire stay. Firstly I was told parking was an additional £10 (which I didn't mind paying), but when I said I would be collecting at 6pm on the day of checkout (the following day), I was told this would cost an additional £5 as it's £10 for 24 hours. I checked in at 17:20. Should queered the £5 for 40 minute? When I then asked if I collect my car at 5pm would I still have to pay the additional sum the answer was yes. Obviously not 24 hours then.
